00001 # Name:    indent.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/13/2013
00004 # Brief:   Namespace for text bindings to handle proper indentations
00005 
00006 namespace eval indent {
00007 
00008   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00009 
00010   array set indent_exprs  {}
00011   array set widgets       {}
00012 
00013   ######################################################################
00014   # Adds indentation bindings for the given text widget.
00015   proc add_bindings {txt} {
00016 
00017     variable widgets
00018 
00019     bind indent$txt <Any-Key> "after 2 [list [ns indent]::check_indent %W insert]"
00020     bind indent$txt <Return>  "after 2 [list [ns indent]::newline %W insert]"
00021 
00022     # Add the indentation tag into the bindtags list just after Text
00023     set text_index [lsearch [bindtags $txt.t] Text]
00024     bindtags $txt.t [linsert [bindtags $txt.t] [expr $text_index + 1] indent$txt]
00025 
00026     # Add the text item to the list of widgets
00027     set widgets($txt.t) 1
00028 
00029   }
00030 
00031   ######################################################################
00032   # Checks the given text prior to the insertion marker to see if it
00033   # matches the unindent expressions.  Increment/decrement
00034   # accordingly.
00035   proc check_indent {txt index} {
00036 
00037     variable indent_exprs
00038 
00039     # If the auto-indent feature was disabled, we are in vim start mode, or
00040     # the current language doesn't have an indent expression, quit now
00041     if {![[ns preferences]::get Editor/EnableAutoIndent] || \
00042         [[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $txt] || \
00043         ($indent_exprs($txt,indent) eq "")} {
00044       return
00045     }
00046 
00047     # If the current line contains an unindent expression, is not within a comment or string,
00048     # and is preceded in the line by only whitespace, replace the whitespace with the proper
00049     # indentation whitespace.
00050     if {([set uindex [$txt search -regexp -- "[join $indent_exprs($txt,unindent) |]\$" "$index linestart" $index]] ne "") && \
00051          ![ctext::inCommentString $txt $uindex]} {
00052       set line [$txt get "$index linestart" $uindex]
00053       if {($line ne "") && ([string trim $line] eq "")} {
00054         $txt replace "$index linestart" $uindex [get_indent_space $txt 1.0 $index]
00055       }
00056     }
00057 
00058   }
00059 
00060   ######################################################################
00061   # Handles a newline character.  Returns the character position of the
00062   # first line of non-space text.
00063   proc newline {txt index} {
00064 
00065     variable indent_exprs
00066 
00067     # If the auto-indent feature was disabled, we are in vim start mode,
00068     # or the current language doesn't have an indent expression, quit now
00069     if {![[ns preferences]::get Editor/EnableAutoIndent] || \
00070         [[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $txt] || \
00071         ($indent_exprs($txt,indent) eq "")} {
00072       return
00073     }
00074 
00075     # Get the current indentation level
00076     set indent_space [get_indent_space $txt 1.0 $index]
00077 
00078     # Check to see if the previous space is greater than the indent space (if so use it instead)
00079     set prev_space [get_previous_indent_space $txt $index]
00080     if {[string length $prev_space] > [string length $indent_space]} {
00081       set indent_space $prev_space
00082     }
00083 
00084     # Get the current line
00085     set line [$txt get $index "$index lineend"]
00086 
00087     # Create an index to restore the insertion cursor, if necessary
00088     set restore_insert ""
00089 
00090     # Remove any leading whitespace and update indentation level
00091     # (if the first non-whitespace char is a closing bracket)
00092     if {[regexp {^( *)(.*)} $line -> whitespace rest] && ($rest ne "")} {
00093 
00094       # If the first non-whitespace characters match an unindent pattern,
00095       # lessen the indentation by one
00096       if {[regexp [subst {^[join $indent_exprs($txt,unindent) |]}] $rest]} {
00097         $txt insert insert "$indent_space\n"
00098         set restore_insert [$txt index insert-1c]
00099         set indent_space [string range $indent_space [[ns preferences]::get Editor/IndentSpaces] end]
00100       }
00101 
00102       # See if we are deleting a multicursor
00103       set mcursor [lsearch [$txt tag names $index] "mcursor"]
00104 
00105       # Delete the whitespace
00106       $txt delete $index "$index+[string length $whitespace]c"
00107 
00108       # If the newline was from a multicursor, we need to re-add the tag since we have deleted it
00109       if {$mcursor != -1} {
00110         $txt tag add mcursor $index
00111       }
00112 
00113     }
00114 
00115     # Insert leading whitespace to match current indentation level
00116     if {$indent_space ne ""} {
00117       $txt insert $index $indent_space
00118     }
00119 
00120     # If we need to restore the insertion cursor, do it now
00121     if {$restore_insert ne ""} {
00122       $txt mark set insert $restore_insert
00123     }
00124 
00125   }
00126 
00127   ######################################################################
00128   # Returns the indentation (in number of spaces) of the previous line
00129   # of text.
00130   proc get_previous_indent_space {txt index} {
00131 
00132     if {![[ns preferences]::get Editor/EnableAutoIndent] || \
00133         [[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $txt] || \
00134         ([lindex [split $index .] 0] == 1)} {
00135       return 0
00136     }
00137 
00138     set line_pos [expr [lindex [split [$txt index $index] .] 0] - 1]
00139 
00140     while {($line_pos > 0) && ([string trim [set line [$txt get "$line_pos.0" "$line_pos.end"]]] eq "")} {
00141       incr line_pos -1
00142     }
00143 
00144     if {($line_pos > 0) && [regexp {^( *)(.*)} $line -> whitespace rest]} {
00145       return $whitespace
00146     } else {
00147       return ""
00148     }
00149 
00150   }
00151 
00152   ######################################################################
00153   # This procedure is called to get the indentation level of the given
00154   # index.
00155   proc get_indent_space {txt start end} {
00156 
00157     variable indent_exprs
00158 
00159     # Initialize the indent_space
00160     set indent_level 0
00161 
00162     # Create the regular expression
00163     set all_re [join [concat $indent_exprs($txt,indent) $indent_exprs($txt,unindent)] |]
00164     set ind_re [subst {^([join $indent_exprs($txt,indent) |])$}]
00165 
00166     # Get the indentation level based on the indent/unindent words found
00167     set i 0
00168     foreach index [$txt search -all -count lengths -regexp -- $all_re $start $end] {
00169       if {[ctext::inCommentString $txt $index] || [ctext::isEscaped $txt $index] || \
00170           (([lindex [split $index .] 1] > 0) && ([$txt get "$index-1c"] eq {\\}))} {
00171         incr i
00172         continue
00173       }
00174       set word [$txt get $index "$index+[lindex $lengths $i]c"]
00175       incr indent_level [expr {[regexp $ind_re $word] ? 1 : -1}]
00176       incr i
00177     }
00178 
00179     return [string repeat " " [expr $indent_level * [[ns preferences]::get Editor/IndentSpaces]]]
00180 
00181   }
00182 
00183   ######################################################################
00184   # Formats the given str based on the indentation information of the text
00185   # widget at the current insertion cursor.
00186   proc format_text {txt startpos endpos} {
00187 
00188     variable indent_exprs
00189 
00190     # If the current language doesn't have an indent expression, quit now
00191     if {$indent_exprs($txt,indent) eq ""} {
00192       return
00193     }
00194 
00195     # Get the current position and recalculate the endpos
00196     set currpos [$txt index "$startpos linestart"]
00197     set endpos  [$txt index $endpos]
00198 
00199     # Update the indentation level at the start of the first text line
00200     if {[$txt compare $startpos == 1.0]} {
00201       set indent_space ""
00202     } else {
00203       set indent_space [get_indent_space $txt 1.0 "$startpos-1l lineend"]
00204     }
00205 
00206     # Create the regular expression containing the indent and unindent words
00207     set uni_re [join $indent_exprs($txt,unindent) |]
00208 
00209     # Find the last open brace starting from the current insertion point
00210     while {[$txt compare $currpos < $endpos]} {
00211 
00212       # Get the current line
00213       set line [$txt get $currpos "$currpos lineend"]
00214 
00215       # Remove the leading whitespace and modify it to match the current indentation level
00216       if {[regexp {^(\s*)(.*)} $line -> whitespace rest]} {
00217         if {[string length $whitespace] > 0} {
00218           $txt delete $currpos "$currpos+[string length $whitespace]c"
00219         }
00220         if {[regexp "^(\\\\)*($uni_re)" $rest -> escapes unindent_match] && \
00221             ![expr [string length $escapes] % 2]} {
00222           set unindent [[ns preferences]::get Editor/IndentSpaces]
00223         } else {
00224           set unindent_match ""
00225           set unindent       0
00226         }
00227         if {$indent_space ne ""} {
00228           $txt insert $currpos [set indent_space [string range $indent_space $unindent end]]
00229         }
00230         append indent_space [get_indent_space $txt "$currpos+[expr [string length $unindent_match] + [string length $indent_space]]c" "$currpos lineend"]
00231       } else {
00232         append indent_space [get_indent_space $txt $currpos "$currpos lineend"]
00233       }
00234 
00235       # Increment the starting position to the next line
00236       set currpos [$txt index "$currpos+1l linestart"]
00237 
00238     }
00239 
00240     # Perform syntax highlighting
00241     [winfo parent $txt] highlight $startpos $endpos
00242 
00243   }
00244 
00245   ######################################################################
00246   # Sets the indentation expressions for the given text widget.
00247   proc set_indent_expressions {txt indent unindent} {
00248 
00249     variable indent_exprs
00250 
00251     # Set the indentation expressions
00252     set indent_exprs($txt,indent)   $indent
00253     set indent_exprs($txt,unindent) $unindent
00254 
00255   }
00256 
00257 }
